texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Every great thing has its end, and the extra services I launched along with  icanhazip.com  are no exception. I started  icanhazip.com  way back in 2009 and detailed much of the history when I  transferred ownership to Cloudflare .
texts.text: Every great thing has its end, and the extra services I launched along with  icanhazip.com  are no exception. I started  icanhazip.com  way back in 2009 and detailed much of the history when I  transferred ownership to Cloudflare .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , came online in 2013 and they weren't part of the Cloudflare transfer. These services add extra challenges since they need IPv6 connectivity and they don't play well with containers. Relative to icanhazip.com, these services receive very little traffic.
texts.text: , came online in 2013 and they weren't part of the Cloudflare transfer. These services add extra challenges since they need IPv6 connectivity and they don't play well with containers. Relative to icanhazip.com, these services receive very little traffic.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As much as I'd like to keep running these sites,  the extra services will go offline on August 17, 2022 .
texts.text: As much as I'd like to keep running these sites,  the extra services will go offline on August 17, 2022 .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: And if you can't live without it
texts.text: And if you can't live without it

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Still need PTR record lookups and traceroutes on your network? All of the code is on GitHub in  major/icanhaz . To run it, simply execute the
texts.text: Still need PTR record lookups and traceroutes on your network? All of the code is on GitHub in  major/icanhaz . To run it, simply execute the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You can also use  gunicorn  with a command like this one:
texts.text: You can also use  gunicorn  with a command like this one:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You can also get very fancy with a systemd unit that exposes a UNIX socket:
texts.text: You can also get very fancy with a systemd unit that exposes a UNIX socket:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
[Unit]
Description=Gunicorn instance to serve icanhaz
After=network.target

[Service]
User=nginx
Group=nginx
WorkingDirectory=/opt/icanhaz
ExecStart=/usr/bin/gunicorn --workers 4 --bind unix:icanhaz.sock -m 007 icanhaz:app

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
texts.text:
[Unit]
Description=Gunicorn instance to serve icanhaz
After=network.target

[Service]
User=nginx
Group=nginx
WorkingDirectory=/opt/icanhaz
ExecStart=/usr/bin/gunicorn --workers 4 --bind unix:icanhaz.sock -m 007 icanhaz:app

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

texts.label: paragraph

paragraph
